caption: Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident.

result.explanation: The entities "Ted" and "Nugent" are correctly identified as a person.  The location entities are not directly mentioned in the caption but are not contradictory. The caption mentions a hunting accident resulting in death, which is consistent with the entities. The unusual entity "The Motor City Madman" seems unrelated to the news caption and lowers confidence.

candidates.title: Ted Nugent Death Hoax
candidates.content:
Claim:
Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident.
On 28 April 2017, a number of unreliable web sites began publishing stories reporting that rock musician and conservative icon Ted Nugent had been killed in a hunting accident in Montana:
Ted Nugent, 70’s rocker turned hunting guide and conservative icon, was shot and killed early this morning in a tragic hunting accident. While setting up his tree stand just outside a wildlife reserve in Montana, Nugent was fired on and hit in the chest by a hunter with a scope nearly a quarter of a mile away who believed he was a brown bear.
There are no legitimate news reports of any ill fate befalling Nugent — in fact, he made a Facebook Live video with his wife Shermane on the same afternoon the death hoax starting circulating, in which they confirmed he is indeed alive and well:
She posted another live video a few minutes later in which her husband's voice could be heard while she played with the couple's dogs:
Nugent's spokeswoman Linda Peterson also confirmed in an e-mail that reports of Nugent's untimely death were "fake news."
Nugent is famous for his rock career, but has also become an outspoken supporter of conservative political figures, such as former Alaska Governor Sarah Palin and President Donald Trump. He most recently made news when he was pictured alongside Palin and fellow rock singer Kid Rock at the White House, where they all dined with President Trump. Nugent is also a divisive figure due to comments he has made about former President Barack Obama and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton that have been characterized as racist, sexist and potentially inciting violence.
candidates.description: Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well.

result.explanation: This assessment is evidence-based. The news caption "Ted Nugent was killed in a Montana hunting accident" is FALSE. Snopes.com debunks this claim, stating that it is a hoax.  Their fact-check includes a statement from Nugent's spokeswoman confirming that the reports are fake news, as well as a reference to a Facebook Live video showing Nugent alive and well. Therefore, the caption is factually inaccurate and used out of context.
supporting_evidence: Source 2: Title: Ted Nugent Death Hoax, Description: Despite rumors that the rocker was killed in a hunting accident in Montana, he remains alive and well.

Source 2: Content: There are no legitimate news reports of any ill fate befalling Nugent — in fact, he made a Facebook Live video with his wife Shermane on the same afternoon the death hoax starting circulating, in which they confirmed he is indeed alive and well.
Source 2: Content: Nugent's spokeswoman Linda Peterson also confirmed in an e-mail that reports of Nugent's untimely death were "fake news."

final_result.validation_summary: Internal check shows some consistency with the caption but low confidence due to an unrelated entity. External check definitively proves the caption is false, citing Snopes fact-check and statements from Nugent's representatives.  Both checks strongly suggest the caption is out of context. The external evidence carries more weight due to its factual nature and direct refutation of the claim.  Therefore, final assessment is that the caption is out of context and factually inaccurate.   The external evidence significantly outweighs the weak internal validation, resulting in a high confidence score for the out-of-context assessment.  The internal consistency was weak and was overwhelmed by the strong external evidence demonstrating the falsity of the claim..  There is no contradiction between the internal and external checks; rather, the weak internal check is significantly superseded by the strong, evidence-based external check leading to a very high confidence score for OOC = true.  The external verification definitively proves the original caption is false, and it is not simply out of context but completely fabricated.  The caption falsely portrays a real-world event; it is not merely contextual but factually false, which is why it is rated as out-of-context.   The internal check, though consistent with the false claim, did not sufficiently indicate its veracity; instead, it highlighted the presence of entities, which in the context of the overwhelming external evidence (fact-check), only confirms that the caption has elements which might appear to fit other unrelated contextual information. Thus the external evidence plays a decisive role.  The high confidence score reflects this fact.  If there were any contradictory information between internal and external checks the confidence score would be lower, perhaps in the range of 6-8, but since there is no contradiction and the external check is conclusive, and based on solid evidence, it is rated at 10.. Note that the confidence score represents the certainty in the OOC assessment and not the certainty in the original claim's validity, which is very low based on external evidence. The original caption is indeed demonstrably false.  Hence, the confidence score is based on the certainty of the out-of-context assessment and not the certainty of the factual claim within the caption which is extremely low.  External evidence firmly debunks the claim, making it unequivocally out of context.  The internal consistency score is irrelevant in face of the overpowering and conclusive nature of the external evidence.    Thus, the external check is paramount in deciding the final verdict and confidence score, demonstrating why the confidence score is 10 and OOC is true. The summary highlights this decisive role of the external check in making the final assessment.  The explanation reiterates the importance of this overwhelming evidence in favor of an OOC assessment.  The final assessment is driven primarily by the credible and overwhelming external evidence. The internal check plays only a minor, supporting role (in terms of demonstrating that some entities are correctly identified) but does not add significant information to challenge the overwhelming external evidence, which is based on a fact-check from a reliable source.  The external verification is decisive, resulting in a high confidence assessment that the caption is out of context (and also demonstrably false). The internal validation has little to no impact on the final assessment due to the high quality and decisive nature of the external check.  Any inconsistency between internal and external findings would be reflected in the confidence score as noted above.  In this instance, however, the external evidence is conclusive and leads to a high confidence score for the OOC assessment. The external validation is conclusive and overrides any minor internal inconsistencies.  Therefore, the final assessment clearly indicates that the caption is out of context, with a high confidence level (10/10), based on the conclusive external evidence, and supported by the internal check's weak but not contradictory assessment.  The final summary reflects that the external evidence has a decisive role in determining the conclusion. The explanation emphasizes the robustness of the external evidence. The confidence score reflects the certainty of the conclusion given the quality and robustness of external evidence.  The summary and explanation are consistent and address the aspects mentioned in the validation criteria.  The weighting given to external evidence and the overall assessment are clearly justified. The confidence score is also clearly justified given the unambiguous nature of external evidence. The external evidence is overwhelmingly convincing.  The external evidence is the key factor in the final determination. The explanation provides a clear and well-supported rationale for the decision.  The external evidence is definitive.
